name: Hotel Globales Reina Cristina

reviews.text: OK, I paid about $55 per night through hotels.com, which is about what a youth hostel costs in Spain, so no complaints there.
reviews.title: Faded grandeur, wonderful character, undergoing renovations

reviews.text: The hotel is undergoing renovations, so hopefully next year this will be back to what must have been an unbelievable hotel. It has such old charm and character - you feel like you're in an F Scott Fitzgerald novel. The bathrooms are updated and modern, though I did see a few ants. The balcony was really cute, and the view of the bay was beautiful. I stayed here to use it as a base for a Gibraltar visit, and that was perfect. Helpful and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Pretty Good!

likes.liked: — Good value room for the price
likes.disliked: — Small room, no fridge, no kettle

reviews.text: The downsides: Wireless didnt work one day, then the landlines didnt work the next. Seems to be an Iberia-wide problem. There is a separate internet computer in one of the lounges where you put in coins, and that worked. The food is OK, not stellar. There is no room service. The air conditioning in the hotel didn't work at all because of the renovations. Luckily, the weather was perfect and i didn't need it. The furniture in the rooms needs upgrading.
reviews.title: Reina Christina AKA: Enola Gay

reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Expedia for a week's stay , basically I just wanted to go somewhere nice and sunny for a week and wasn't that bothered about the actual location, hence I wasn't too concerned that the town of Algeciras was by most accounts a bit of a dump, because the hotel sounded very nice from the description on Expedia, and considering it was advertised as a 4 star I was offered a room for an absolute bargain price, so much so that I thought 'there must be a catch - what's this hotel really like?' I had a look at the reviews on Tripadvisor to see, however, as is quite often the case on here, the reviews seemed to be roughly divided between people saying it was absolutely marvellous and others saying it was bloody awful - so I wasn't really any the wiser!
reviews.title: Dissatisfied! Problems with ants.
Avoid this hotel like the plague
reviews.text: Anyway, my experience was very much in the positive camp. I arrived in a bit of a bad mood, having managed to get lost trying to find the hotel after arriving at the bus station (it's actually only about 10 minutes walk from the town centre, if you've got a half decent map and - unlike me - a passable sense of direction, then you shouldn't have any trouble finding it!) and I was booked in quickly and efficiently by a friendly lady on reception, who to my relief, as my Spanish is virtually non-existant, spoke perfect English. So, to my room....I have to say, that for a 4 star hotel, the room was a lot smaller than I was expecting. Also, I was hoping there might have been a mini-bar, or at least a fridge in which I could have chilled a few beers. And it would have been nice to have had tea/coffee making facilities as well. Apart from that though, everything else was ok - it was all clean, I had a nice ensuite, which had bath, shower and bidet, the bed was comfortable, there was a big wardrobe. The TV was only a portable, and it only had 2 English language channels, both of which were news (CNN and BBC world) but then I don't go on holiday to watch TV. I think I was definitely in one of their 'budget' rooms, but for the price I paid I don't have any complaints at all. What else can I tell you? Well, there's a nice pool area, clean, with plenty of sunloungers, and the food was generally good. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of hot and cold food, occasionally a few of the cooked items were a bit lukewarm, but on the whole the quality was fine. I also ate in the 'a la carte' restaurant a couple of times, and thought that was good as well. All the staff I encountered were friendly and helpful, and spoke good English.

reviews.title: Let's be objective - a fine hotel!
Like Going Home
reviews.text: We were all inclusive and were pretty sick of the food by day 3, everything was deep fried and chips, no real food.

As the subject of this review indicates this was the worst experience I have every had with a hotel. As a frequent traveller, I have seen my fair share of hotels around the world and am familar with the "star system" in Europe (which often confuses some travellers), but I can safely say the two nights I had to stay here were the worst two nights in a hotel ever.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience I Have Ever Had

likes.disliked: — The fact I had to stay here.

reviews.text: I reserved a room with two beds and AC (necessary in Spain in August) and upon check in was given a room that matched this description; however it was not cleaned since the last guest. The next room was no bigger than a closet with only a single bed. The third room had no AC, I kid you not when I say it had a floor standing fan in place of AC. The fourth room was a "suite"; however the AC in this room barely worked and after 5 hours of it running, the room was no cooler. The fifth room I tried, yes fifth, was effectively in the basement. It smelled moldy and while the AC seemed to work slightly better than the others, it only had a single bed. We (a friend and I) ending up taking this room as we were told nothing else was open that night. Upon waking in the morning we found the AC had quit working, hence the reason we woke up sweaty. That morning we asked about another room and were told something nice would be available in the afternoon. So we repacked our bags, put them into storage and went out for the day. Upon returning we were presented with another room that was hot as an oven with nominial AC. We had to request another fan to keep it someone decent in the room.
reviews.title: A haven of old fashioned quality

reviews.text: SIX rooms - All failures in my eyes as we were never given a room with two beds AND air conditioning.
reviews.title: Seen more Lively Funerals... Not for Brits

reviews.text: To top this horrible experience off, the breakfast which was included was foul. The foods that should be hot were ice cold and the foods that should have been cold were warm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Uncommercialised and a wonderful experience. Rooms were spacious and elegant. Bathrooms were immaculate and clean. The setting and grounds have a fantatsic ambience. The staff were exceptionally helpful and we had instant response to any concerns we raised. The food was of a high standard and varied throughout our weeks stay.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a fantatstic setting.

likes.disliked: — No tea and coffee making facilities in rooms. Hairdryers not available in all rooms.

reviews.title: Reina First Visit
reviews.text: I would have no hestitaion in recommending this hotel to anyone. The town itself is a busy port and and the town centre is a bustling area with a wide variety of shops. Although not much English is spoken here, we were able to communicate sufficiently well to be understood. A far better place to get a feel for the 'real' Spain.
There are excellent roads and all are well signposted, so we did not need to rely on the sat nav we took with us. An excellent base to use to see other towns if you hire a car, which we did.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: We flew into Malaga Airport, some 90 miles away. However, Gibraltar is only about 10 miles away and there are daily flights from the UK.
reviews.title: I have no complaints at all

description: The Globales Reina Cristina Hotel of Algeciras, Cádiz, very close to the crystal clear waters of the beaches of Tarifa (just 10 min.), opened in 1901. Renovated in February 2006. Discover a unique colonial style in the hotel. Explore the ruins of an 8th century Muslim mosque and an Arabic well from this period, which still works. This hotel of the Costa del Sol is surrounded by palm tree gardens. It has an outdoor swimming pool, an indoor swimming pool, two tennis courts, a gym and sauna. Enjoy cetacean and migratory bird sightings and giant red tuna fishing. The hotel for its proximity, is a strategic place since it is located on the Gibraltar Strait and perfect for travelling between Europe and Africa. Throughout the Globales Reina Cristina Hotel you'll enjoy DSL and wireless Internet (WI-FI) in the reception area, main halls and all the rooms. Also, you'll have modern and friendly services and all the accommodation services according to your preferences. Hold meetings or venues in the hotel in one of the equipped halls (8 in total) or celebrate your wedding or banquet with the best professionals and equipment.
